result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Henry W Alfieri

records.addlTxt:
10:52 AM Defendant Henry W Alfieri not in court.  Attorney Michelle M Erdman in court for Henry W Alfieri.  Prosecuting attorney John Michael O'Boyle in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney Erdman relates on whereabouts of Defendant and requests reset.  JA to reset.
Adjourned initial appearance on October 26, 2022 at 10:00 am.

10:12 AM Defendant Henry W Alfieri not in court.  Attorney Michelle M Erdman appeared by video for Henry W Alfieri.  Prosecuting attorney Brady James Seidlitz in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Erdman relates DE hospitalized and requests reset.  Hearing reset to 10/26/2022 at 10:00 AM. Notice of hearing to be sent to DE with Judge Bitney's Zoom info.  Parties may appear by zoom.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 26, 2022 at 10:00 am.

10:02 AM Attorney Michelle M Erdman appeared by video for Henry W Alfieri.  Prosecuting attorney John Michael O'Boyle in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

10:03 State relates.  Adjourned.  
Bond to continue.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 21, 2022 at 10:00 am.

1:40 PM Prosecuting attorney Brian H. Wright Aty in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Henry W Alfieri in court.  Attorney Alex Kitto appeared by video for Henry W Alfieri.
Court relates. Public Defender has not located counsel.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 7, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Office of State Public Defender Appointment of Counsel Report

Defendant shall be fingerprinted at the Barron County Sheriff's Dept., if not already done.
If represented by the Public Defender and does not have a phone, must contact the Public Defender weekly at 715-908-8473.

1:31 PM Prosecuting attorney Brady James Seidlitz in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Henry W Alfieri appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Alex Kitto (for today) appeared by video for Henry W Alfieri. 

1:34  Court relates and gives appearances.
Atty. Kitto will interview defendant today; defendant not to be released until Atty. Kitto has visited with him.
AIA set; must appear in person.

(Bond and MS scanned to jail)
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 5, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
